WorkItem.Description: Seems to be very tricky to get list of installed bitmap encoders and decoders and other components via the IWICImagingFactory::CreateComponentEnumerator which is unavailable in WPF. The correct code with .NET 4.0 interop features would be very useful, and returning CodecInfo in the case of encoders/decoders welcomed.

Comments.Message:
Hello JanKucera

Thank you for using our code sample request service!

There are generally two options to interop with WIC from .NET:
1. Use WPF and the System.Windows.Media.Imaging namespace
2. Use COm Interop with the WIC interfaces (see http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/wictools for WicCop which contains an export of all of the APIs for C#).

As you said, WPF does not expose all low-level WIC APIs (also see http://blogs.microsoft.co.il/blogs/tomershamam/archive/2007/09/21/wpf-image-processing.aspx), but the second option should probably meet your need. Could you please let me know if it meets your need? If necessary, I can write a similar code sample in All-In-One Code Framework.

Hello Jialiang

The WicCop is exactly what I was looking for. Amazing no one was able to mention this code in the official WIC forums. Thank you for the code reference, feel free to close this request. Have a nice day!

Jan
